intro: Tetrapterys anisoptera, commonly known as the broadleaf sand mat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy, ovate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Its ecological role includes stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various insect species.
